result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick W Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges.  DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick W Morgan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to  DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION, ATTN RECORDS, 2909  E PARK AVE, CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed. 

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (37 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2015 received and filed.
Original DUPLICATE  PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (10 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2015 received and filed.
Original DUPLICATE  PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (10 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS, with credit for 37 days time served CONCURRENT TO CASE #15CF3275; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to payment of costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Patrick W Morgan in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Patrick W Morgan in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers on the record, discussion ordered SEALED. Matter is called on the record. Defendant present. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms and body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
- undated from Shelia Morgan, filed.
